summary: Christ the Redeemer is a huge statue of Jesus in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil. It stands 30 meters tall and has its arms spread wide. The statue was built between 1922 and 1931 by a team of artists and engineers from different countries. It weighs 635 metric tons and is located at the top of Corcovado mountain, overlooking the city. The statue is made of concrete and soapstone and is the largest Art Deco sculpture in the world. It is a famous symbol of Christianity and one of the New 7 Wonders of the World.
title: Christ the Redeemer (statue)
